results.title: Primary media studies
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok, Film Media Studies and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Indicates various types of activities that could be included in a primary media studies course. Shows hand drawing on film, making storyboards, exercises in persistence of vision, stimuli for creative writing, drama with video and script development.

results.title: Children talking to writers
results.brief_description: This compilation tape contains three programmes in which children interview well-known Australian writers of children’s stories: Christobel Mattingley, Daphne Bidwell and Hugh Edwards. The writers talk about how they discipline themselves to work, and describe the sources of inspiration for their writing.
results.description: This compilation tape contains three programmes in which children interview well-known Australian writers of children’s stories: Christobel Mattingley, Daphne Bidwell and Hugh Edwards. results.title: Catchwords: ideas for spelling
results.creator_credit: O. Hollander and Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College
results.brief_description: Charles Cripps, author of the spelling manual “Catchwords” is interviewed by Sue Brockfield and Howard Mould. Cripps outlines several strategies useful for the teaching of spelling. He strongly advocates the “look, cover, write and check” system which is explained during the interview.
results.creator_credit_for_label: O. Hollander and Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College

results.title: Not only to save our jobs

video_links.name: Not only to save our jobs

results.brief_description: Shows how a group of people at a small Melbourne manufacturing company acted to overcome the threat of losing their jobs by setting up a new form of organisation based on worker participation in ownership and decision-making. The effects on employees’ attitudes and work relationships are shown.

results.title: Open doors ... opportunities in trade training for women
results.brief_description: Interviews with women apprentices show the opportunities in various trades; they are training to be nursery attendants, motor mechanics, plumbers, refrigeration mechanics, and optical glass makers. They speak about career prospects, work satisfaction and attitudes towards female apprentices. No other credits available.
results.title_for_label: Open doors … opportunities in trade training for women

results.title: Introduction to horizontal jumping: long jump - triple jump
results.creator_credit: Ron Taylor and Department of Education, Queensland
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to horizontal jumping. Shows flexibility and warm-up exercises and gives comprehensive information on run-up, take-off, flight and landing techniques.

results.title: Ash Wednesday
results.brief_description: Provides a detailed look at the tragedy of the Ash Wednesday bush fires that destroyed a large section of southeastern Australia on 16th February 1983.

results.title: Through a looking glass; Drama is -
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Two drama education programs: “Through a looking glass” shows the major concepts underlaying drama in education and how the teacher can participate with the student in the dramatic process. “Drama is -” explores the ways in which drama can be used as a method to teach many subject areas.
